intro: Crotonogyne micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
